comments: working on VAN capability Sat 25 Jul 2020 01:36:37 PM CDT
minor fixes 7/25/2020
this include having two variants, VANDARK and VANLIGHT
NOTE: these variants apply across all objects, including the generic header
title page, etc.
updated 9/28/2018 put city name inside box
updated 6/10/2018 change preface wording for HTML users
updated 5/25/2018 add replacement project strings for CSS override
updated 5/24/2018 add code for external access to images
updated 4/13/2018 put publish date from project.json into POEM heading
updated 3/20/2018 to break POEM into its own structure by name
updated 3/20/2018 to break SKEL into its own structure by name
updated 3/19/2018 fix syntax errors
updated 2/7/2018 for setting font size in a list
updated 2/5/2018 for making TOC a popup/down
updated 1/27/2018 for creating any HTML using options settings
ALL entries will be grouped and start with name of format, such as 'POEM
updated 5/21/2017 for project-agnostic, format-specific project
NOTHING IN HERE will be specific to any project
NOT USED, only for documentation
For HTML, we have to manually make a table of contents(see documentation below)
12/16/2017 -- Add comments used later to inject special Javascript for MPHS online viewing
Static front material is for each web page
Table of contents are only the heading (one string)
rest are created from the MANIFEST information

VANDARK:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<!DOCTYPE html
PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
<html>
<head>
<!-- VANILLA DARK layout system used here -->
<!-- COMMENT NO EXTERNAL ACCESS, this page is for offline reading -->
<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html"/>
<meta name="Author" content="PROJECT_AUTHOR"/>
 PROJECT_COPYRIGHT
<!-- hard-code CSS, not using this <link rel='STYLESHEET' href='PROJECT_HTML_CSS'/> -->
<!-- the following override really OUGHT to contain all css code, including inline alterations, not the stuff that follows.... -->
<!-- HOWEVER, DARK mode has overrides for the colors of <a links specifically, so those overrides are given later in this header -->
PROJECT_OVERRIDE_CSS
<title>PROJECT_TITLE</title>
<meta name="keywords" content="
 PROJECT_KEYWORDS
<meta name="description" content="PROJECT_DESCRIPTION"/>
<meta name="EPB-UUID" content="PROJECT_ISBN"/>
  <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1"/>
<script type="text/javascript" src="utility_v.js"><!-- VANILLA specific popup code -->
<!-- must be full tag set to work with IE 6 -->
</script>
<!-- override Vanilla settings and add special items for our use -->
<!-- THIS STUFF should probably be more project-specific and added to the OVERRIDE above -->
<!-- HOWEVER, these link colors will only work with DARK mode -->
<style type="text/css">
  a:link { color: #ff0; font-size: 100%; /* font-size: 100%;   inline no special size */ }
  a:visited { color: #aa0; font-size: 100%; /* font-size: 100%;   inline no special size */ }
  a:link.seealso { color: #ff0; font-size: 110%; /* font-size: 100%;   inline no special size */ }
  a:visited.seealso { color: #aa0; font-size: 110%; /* font-size: 100%;   inline no special size */ }
p.caption
  {
   clear:left; 
   font-size: 80%; 
   font-style: italic;
  }
</style>
TTOCC
<!-- google analytics SCRIPTS would be here -->
</head>
<body>
<!-- vanilla boilerplate for top of webpage -->
<!-- specifically the dark background 'dashdashaccent' is used in this mode -->
<section class='p-strip--accent ' >
<div class='row'>
<div class='col-12'>
<!-- end Vanilla DARK static header content -->

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<!DOCTYPE html
PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
<html>
<head>
<!-- VANILLA LIGHT (default) layout system used here -->
<!-- COMMENT NO EXTERNAL ACCESS, this page is for offline reading -->
<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html"/>
<meta name="Author" content="PROJECT_AUTHOR"/>
 PROJECT_COPYRIGHT
<!-- hard-code CSS, not using this <link rel='STYLESHEET' href='PROJECT_HTML_CSS'/> -->
<!-- the following override really OUGHT to contain all css code, including inline alterations, not the stuff that follows.... -->
<!-- HOWEVER, we are defaulting to the LIGHT mode and the entries that override later in this header are best left there -->
PROJECT_OVERRIDE_CSS
<title>PROJECT_TITLE</title>
<meta name="keywords" content="
 PROJECT_KEYWORDS
<meta name="description" content="PROJECT_DESCRIPTION"/>
<meta name="EPB-UUID" content="PROJECT_ISBN"/>
  <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1"/>
<script type="text/javascript" src="utility_v.js"><!-- VANILLA specific popup code -->
<!-- must be full tag set to work with IE 6 -->
</script>
<!-- override Vanilla settings and add special items for our use -->
<!-- THIS STUFF should probably be more project-specific and added to the OVERRIDE above -->
<!-- except we are dealing with link colors here -->
<style type="text/css">
  a:link { /* no color change here color: #ff0; */ font-size: 100%; /* font-size: 100%;   inline no special size */ }
  a:visited { /* no color change here color: #aa0; */ font-size: 100%; /* font-size: 100%;   inline no special size */ }
  a:link.seealso { /* no color change here color: #ff0; */ font-size: 110%; /* font-size: 100%;   inline no special size */ }
  a:visited.seealso { /* no color change here color: #aa0; */ font-size: 110%; /* font-size: 100%;   inline no special size */ }
p.caption
  {
   clear:left; 
   font-size: 80%; 
   font-style: italic;
  }
</style>

<!-- google analytics SCRIPTS would be here -->
</head>
<body>
<!-- vanilla light boilerplate for top of webpage -->
<!-- using normal white background p-strip here, NOT dark <section class='p-stripdashdashaccent ' -->
<section class='p-strip ' style='border: 1px solid #cdcdcd;'>
<div class='row'>
<div class='col-12'>
<!-- end Vanilla static header content -->

VANLIGHT: <!-- COMMENT NO EXTERNAL ACCESS, this page is for offline reading -->
<!-- hard-code CSS, not using this <link rel="STYLESHEET" href="PROJECT_HTML_CSS"/> -->
<!-- override VANILLA settings and add special items for our use -->
<!-- google analytics SCRIPTS would be here -->
<!-- vanilla boilerplate for top of webpage -->
This is a version of the PROJECT_TYPE for use in a web browser. As such, this PROJECT_TYPE is a completely
self-contained, interactive product, just as if you were reading a website. Each web page
has a simple Table of Contents at the top of the page.
Click on the prompt to open and close the Table of Contents information.
The Table of Contents links that appear point
to all of the general document-wide indexes. The PROJECT_TYPE is meant to be read in any order, with
no specific flow, aside from the order of the items listed in the Table of Contents. With a
web browser, you have complete control to move 'back' through your reading pathway. This is not
the same as an EPUB or PDF document, which have a specific flow from page to page. Both the indexes and Table
of Contents are made up of links that will send you to the appropriate text or illustration.

The font and layout were designed to work with computer screens, phones, and tablets. The viewer may not always get the ideal font size, depending on the device used. Just use the buttons at the top of each page to make the text larger or smaller.
The illustrations seen in-line are smaller thumbnails of the full illustrations.
Clicking on the caption under the thumbnail activates a pop-up window with a higher-quality illustration.
Use of this feature requires that you configure your browser to 'allow pop-up
windows'. The method of enabling this feature differs with each browser type.

This is a version of the PROJECT_TYPE for use in a web browser. As such, this PROJECT_TYPE is a completely
self-contained, interactive product, just as if you were reading a website. Each web page
has a simple Table of Contents at the top of the page.
The Table of Contents links at the top of each page point
to all of the general document-wide indexes. The PROJECT_TYPE is meant to be read in any order, with
no specific flow, aside from the order of the items listed in the Table of Contents. With a
web browser, you have complete control to move 'back' through your reading pathway. This is not
the same as an EPUB or PDF document, which have a specific flow from page to page. Both the indexes and Table
of Contents are made up of links that will send you to the appropriate text or illustration.

The font and layout were designed to work with computer screens, phones, and tablets. However, the viewer may have trouble with the font size, depending on the device used. It is recommended that computer users, in particular use the CRTL+ key combination to make the screen view larger, if the font appears to be too small.

The illustrations seen in-line are smaller thumbnails of the full illustrations.
Clicking on the caption below each thumbnail activates a pop-up window with the full-quality illustration.
Use of this feature requires that you configure your browser to 'allow pop-up
windows'. The method of enabling this feature differs with each browser type.
